item.description:
@Frantix wrote:

What would be a more efficient method of doing this, I think it’s the only way i’m not sure I just want to see what you guys think.

[code=csharp] private void previous1_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
{
this.firstT.ForeColor = System.Drawing.Color.Blue;
this.firstT.Text = "Result: " + previous0.Text;
}

    private void previous2_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.firstT.ForeColor = System.Drawing.Color.Blue;
        this.firstT.Text = "Result: " + previous1.Text;
    }

    private void previous3_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.firstT.ForeColor = System.Drawing.Color.Blue;
        this.firstT.Text = "Result: " + previous2.Text;
    }

    private void previous4_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.firstT.ForeColor = System.Drawing.Color.Blue;
        this.firstT.Text = "Result: " + previous3.Text;
    }

    private void previous5_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.firstT.ForeColor = System.Drawing.Color.Blue;
        this.firstT.Text = "Result: " + previous4.Text;
    }[/code]
